intro: [WRONG START] Lypertia antirrhinoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf lypertia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are narrow and linear, contributing to its drought-resistant structure.
